history.text: What is the name of the movie?
The movie is called "The Post"
It just came out last year
What was so interesting about it?
What was so interesting about it was that it was actually based on a true story
it had an all star cast "Meryl Streep" "Tom Hanks"

Would you consider watching
 it in your spare time?
It also really was timely because it deals with a lot of things going on today in politics even though the story happened almost 40 years ago
I definitely would
What was the plot?
Was it complicated? Could it be followed?

The plot basically centers around some journalists who work for the Washington Post who want to publish The Pentagon Papers, which were these secret files about the US involvement in Vietnam over the prior three decades
Its a little complicated and probably better for later teens and adults to watch
Does it involve more true based stories or more of a fake news type of thing? (in your opinion)
I think the research is pretty accurate, there might be some creative liberties taken with the characters private conversations but the broad historical context is quite accurate and verifiable
Is it centered around the Vietnam war?

Definitely, it focuses on the US government's effort to hush or quiet the reasons their in the war and communicate that they are positive about the results even thought their involvement has yielded little
So does the Vietnam war effect the focus or direction of this film? Or is it just mentioned in the context?

It definitely centers on the US' involvement and for such an extended period of time so I think think its certainly the focus of the story even if we are viewing it from outside of vietnam, its the gasoline that lets the engine of the film run
Makes sense. How about the reviews. From what you have read, do you think they are going to be positive or more on the negative side?

Overall I think the reviews are going to be average to good. However due to the current political climate around how the government and news institutions operate its going to certainly incense some critics.
Is this more of a Conservative type of media, or liberal. Which side is going to take offense?
Its hard to say though Critics sometimes say things for reasons non of us can understand
Does this sound like a movie you'd watch?
(Still there?)
To who is this movie portrayed for

what type of political audience
?
Hello?
